item.title: HTB Union Write-up
item.description:
As always, starting off with our nmap scans, we do a quick and comprehensive scan.

$sudo nmap --open 10.10.11.128 -oA union_top1k                                │Starting Nmap 7.94SVN ( https://nmap.org ) at 2025-01-25 10:40 EST
[sudo] password for jsmooth:                                                       │
Starting Nmap 7.94SVN ( https://nmap.org ) at 2025-01-25 10:40 EST                 │
Nmap scan report for 10.10.11.128                                                  │
Host is up (0.026s latency).                                                       │
Not shown: 999 filtered tcp ports (no-response)                                    │
Some closed ports may be reported as filtered due to --defeat-rst-ratelimit        │
PORT   STATE SERVICE                                                               │
80/tcp open  http

Comprehensive:

item.title: HTB Forest Write-up
item.description: The Forest machine is a unique box due to it being entirely Active Directory. I agree with IppSec that this box should probably be rated medium rather than easy. However, I think this is a great box to practice your Active Directory enumeration skills and really dig into using BloodHound to find specific attack paths. There is a funky aspect of this box in which a script is being run to reset your user’s privileges, and this causes some weird problems you wouldn’t normally have.
